metadata.Title: CVE-2017-6062 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The "OpenID Connect Relying Party and OAuth 2.0 Resource Server" (aka mod_auth_openidc) module before 2.1.5 for the Apache HTTP Server does not skip OIDC_CLAIM_ and OIDCAuthNHeader headers in an "OIDCUnAuthAction pass" configuration, which allows remote attackers to bypass authentication via crafted HTTP traffic.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-6062` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-auth-openidc - 2.3.3-1build1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libapache2-mod-auth-openidc package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.3.3-1build1').
